caption: The staff is wonderful from the waiters to the owner. Of all the places to go for a hookah in New York this is the place to be!

The experience wasn’t pleasant at all the workers are slow and they always look angry they never smile so the welcoming aspect is not even present, the coals are changed on my hookah when the hookah is practically dead, and no one came to my table to check up on us it was like if you need something you have to get up so I would recommend not wasting money here and rather go to other lounges where service is much better and they don’t even take debit card which is odd I been hearing different excuses that either their card machine is not working or something else there is a problem.

Favorite hookah lounge in Astoria!  Consistent. Timely coal changes. Great Moroccan Mint tea - and decent outdoor setup. The price is very reasonable too.  The only ding is for being cash only. They also allow payments via venmo so that's my go to option. Food is pretty decent although I've not extensively checked it out - the menu is massive and includes all the main items.  They do occasionally have fresh hot Kunefe - ask for it!
I am giving the one star just for the manager... he saw one of his nice employee (old man) waiting for customers outside in cold, he start yelling at him and be so bad to him...
Overall best but i was overcharged the price also they're accepting only cash payments.
Very kind workers and owners, however make sure to have cash

Went on a weekday and ordered Lamb rack. The place was full but with only 2 servers, we received our order almost 45 minutes later. The lamb was cold and off course didn't taste upto it's potential.  First we received rice and 10 minutes later Lamb rack and another 15 minutes later (after we ate most of the lamb) the potatoes that were ordered in the beginning. My advise is to not order lamb rack on weekdays. Need good service.

Great spot great atmosphere. Only stopped for some hookah and tea but the food looked and smelled amazing can't wait to go back
Good place,  very good vibe the owner is super friendly hookah is always on point great place

I'm in NYC every week for business and have been wanting to try this place ... Well we stopped in yesterday for lunch and a hookah...they just started opening at 2:00pm a few days earlier.  We were starving and couldn't wait to get something to eat...so we started with several appetizers...I can recommend everything I ate...all delicious. We started with: Fried Kibbeh fried cracked wheat stuffed with ground meat & onions - it was served with a Ranch "like" sauce - very tasty Falafel vegetable patties deep fried - delicious - Stuffed Grape Leaves, stuffed with rice, tomatoes, parsley, mint & olive oil, they were served warm and tasted magnificent. And Naturally we had hummus - there was warmed Pita for us to enjoy with the hummus - I really enjoyed all these appetizers. My friend and I shared a Lunch Entree - a Shish Kebab Sandwich, tender lamb grilled with onions, and peppers grilled in flatbread....served with fries DELICIOUS. Both my friend and I enjoy Hookah - so we had a Lemon Mint shisha and later enjoy another round of Blue Mist - GREAT HOOKAHS, the bowls are packed well and they continually replenish your coals as needed. I recommend this place - the Decor is very Morocco meets Dubai lounge.....a very friendly staff and just a cool place to hang out - I can't wait to go back
Friendly atmosphere, great food great hookah.. almost 15 years and still the only place we'll spend saturday nights at.
Food was good, but no cards...
The reason we go here is because of the owner who treats us like family. Food is delicious, service is quick and atmosphere is relaxing.
One of the smoothest hookah I've ever had. The owner is fantastic and even provided us with some free dessert.
Gorgeous!! Definitely an Arab like feel. The staff was amazing. Had a lovely evening... 💛

Excellent food and gorgeous decor! Visit Lebanon without boarding a plane. We ordered a variety of delicious appetizers including lamb liver, hummus and kibble. For desert we ordered konafe and a triple mouse chocolate cake, with Turkish coffee. Everything was delicious

Ordered the mix grill platter. I eat kefta and lamb chops all the time, so I know the good spots. This one I wouldn't recommend the kefta and chops. Chicken and kebab were good! Hookah is about a 6 out of 10. Mint lemonade was really good. Staff was amazing. Overall nice cozy place to hang out. Oh yeah they take cash only!!!
Real arabic atmosfere, tasty food, great shisha/hookah/narghile and delicious tea. The interior design recalls the authentic Moroccan chilled ambience.

Food is amazing for a hookah lounge. Hookah was amazing too. The vibe is great. Not like most lounges, not rowdy and people doing reckless stuff. The owner and staff are amazingly nice! They care about your hookah, food and you. The hot beverages are on point too! 🙌

Me and my friend went here tonight.  Waiter hit on my friend, asked if she was dating me and tried to get her phone number after being rebuffed.  Neither of us were treated with respect.  Don't go here!
The food was outstanding. The salad was so fresh and the whole atmosphere was great. The service was superb, it was like we had someone so close to us to serve us at moments notice.
A nice place with a nice ambiance and great respectful staff.Thank you.

Hookah - Good quality, prices are reasonable. Tea and cake were good.  Service - Amazing, they treat you like you’re family.  Overall - Recommend. The decor is one of the best. The place is clean and cute. Definitely check it out.
Milk shake is great. Atmosphere is nice and calm.Staff is polite and well mannered.
Good cafe

I think this restaurant is a really good place to have Libanese food in a great atmosphere with comfortable chairs, good and traditional music, nice decoration, good attention, and overall great food. The dishes are very typically and very well done. We ordered an appetizer with a creamy hummus and eggplant and salads. The hot plates were really flavorfull, especially the "lamb stew" which I highly recommend. Portions are very big so can share and take home. Maybe to improve I would say they are quite slow at serving the food.

Very warm and welcoming staff: the owner is very personable and treated us like family. Truly a special experience. Comfortable, romantic, and relaxed atmosphere; with excellent ventilation! Don't come here with an agenda; just sit back and relax! Hookah and food were both very tasty; it was a perfect night.
The best place from Astoria to go have nice night

I have been regularly and continuously going to Leyali Beirut for the past 2 years almost and I have brought my friends, relatives, stars and even my own family to visit this great place.  To start things off the scenery is very relaxing and homey. The minute you walk in and take a look at the comfortable furniture, decorations, lights, music and ambience you feel as if you're actually visiting someone's house in the heart of Beirut.  While most places in Steinway typically either have a nightclub setting or a very cheap recreation room sort of asthetic, you automatically feel at home with the way one feels welcome when one walks in. You can sit down - watch TV, gather and just relax listening to either classic Arabic tunes or whats going on in the media.  In regards to the staff - the owner Nabeel is one the most kindest and welcoming individuals anyone can ever meet upon entering his resteraunt, he runs the resteraunt as if he's running his own house and makes sure you feel welcome. In addition, he was many staff workers who are very kind and committed and also make sure to take care of whatever food you need - so you wont feel awkward or pressured by asking anything.  When it comes to the food - I truly ask you to take my word on this and say that whatever people have said in the past is something I personally haven't experianced.  The food is fresh and right off the fire and grill, the ingrediants are top quality and the drinks/deserts are often made locally as soon as you order. Take it from me - even something as simple as the Lentil soup will definently make you hungry for more and the Lamb chops, kebabs and various entrees are not to be underestimate - the best advice I usually give to newcomers is to order a mixed grill as you get a huge plate you can share with 2-3 people with a wide mix of grilled meat that comes with your choice of salad or fries - adding a side of hummus also doesnt hurt at all.  The hookah is also something to be greatly desired after. As of now, they have recruited this really brilliant young Algerian guy with a little top knot who makes the hookah fresh and its very much worth it. The hookah can last you for a long while, the quality is great and the price is half of what you pay at all these nightclub type of spots coming around. I personally love the Lemon or Lemont Mint Hookah but you have many different options and heads to choose from.  To sum it all up - if you're looking for a great spot to hang out with friends, have a date, family get together or even come down to a nice place where you can get your work done in a café environment - I truly would and have reccomended this place in the time Ive come here.  Coming from someone who has tries hookah spots from Jamaica to New Jersey, Leyali Beirut is the spot - it may be a little pricy but you get your complete money's worth and time and always want to come back for more.  If you have any doubts or questions about this review, please feel free to comment or reach out to me as this is completely my honest opinion.

Cash and only cash, the system is always down... Lol. The food was below standards, the place is so old and needs to be well maintained. The only good thing about this place is the people.those two stars for the 2 people working there.

This is my spot on Steinway.  Layali Beirut is a little quieter than the nearby ruckus, so it's a great place to relax over a meal and hookah with close friends.  The decor is warm and inviting, and the menu offers excellent traditional and Western-friendly fare.  Polite, obliging staff and great hookah top it off for a well-deserved five stars!  The owner, if you are fortunate enough to meet him, is a true gem of humanity.  Visit and discover for yourself....

Great place to enjoy with friends and groups, had a nice time. Food is great and hospitality is good as well. However it was a bit expensive, but tasty Lebanese food. The waiters are very nice. Our waiter  named Maria was phenomenal. She was constantly there if we needed anything and helped us without any hesitation. At the end she wrote us a note which was very special. It made us feel welcome and thankful. It was a pleasure to eat at Layali Beirut. Loved it!!!

New: I changed my 4 stars to 2 stars because of the bad experience last 2 times. I’m a regular customer from 6 months and it was always good experience before especially in hookah but They changed their man from last 1 month who make hookah and first he doesn’t understand what is the order (always bring wrong flavour). Secondly he don’t know how to make hookah. No smoke no flavour. He just put more coals to increase smoke which just taste like burnt coals. I stop going there anymore because of the hookah maker. I hope they will hire some good hookah maker and will not lose customer base anymore!  Old comment: Food and Hookah is good.
Excellent service! Great food!!!

Probably one of the best restaurants/hookah lounges I’ve been to. The food always comes out QUICK, SEASONED and FRESH! Hookah is banging, management is friendly, and the service is great! And let’s not forget about the fishyyyy! There’s a mini aquarium there ❤️

My Number one favorite spot to hang with my friends . Beautiful atmosphere, Great music, Delicious food 😋, Fast service, Variety of delicious flavors for hookah💨 They also have different Game Boards🎲, Cards♦️, Dominos. OMG can’t believe I almost forgot the DESSERT 🍮🍰🥧😋😋😋

Great Lebanese food! Order the hummus, labne, tabbouleh, ask for spicy soujouk with tomato sauce. Great ambience! And great hookah! Do the grape on a grapefruit. Make sure you go with a disposable hose. (This is a fact at any hookah lounge, if you want an optimal experience you need a disposable hose to not have any “ghosting” issues.)
Awesome place. Great service by the owner and his team. Will deff come back!!

Food was not delicious and also cold. The prices were expensive and the service was under 0. You should ask at least 5 times. They didn’t even tell us that they don’t accept card. At the end when they bring  a check they tell us that they only accept cash. The worse place ever I saw in US !

Very slow service, I waited 50 minutes for my food. Also I had to pay cash when luckily friends had cash I only had card. Normal service should tell us in advance if it’s only cash, also normal service would check up on us frequently but they didn’t. I will report to 311 due to the fact that they are only accepting cash.

caption: I love the food  Service is amazing and where do I start about the hookah many delicious flavors highly recommended place right in the heart of stinway way one of the most amazing Arabian nights experience I’ve ever had

Amazing night! Great food. Great ambiance. Came in with friends from work from different backgrounds. The owner and his table made an effort to switch the usual arab ambience to ozuna and memphis bleek. Love this place. Great job to the owner and his team.

I was about to leave a review praising the place as one of Steinway's best kept secrets, citing the great food and hookah, but I reconsider this as a result of one of the owners/partners rattling off a couple of racist jokes.  In all honesty the jokes were clever, and maybe a little amusing.  I say this as an African person who was the indirect subject matter of these "black jokes".  But the uncomfortable roar of laughter coming from the owners table as my party left Layali reminded me of how ugly those jokes can be.   Inhospitable.  Ma'salaam.

Few of my friends went to this place on a tuesday night. Their mixed grill was not a lot comparing to the price but it was delicious. We ordered pina colada Sheesha on a pineapple. The sheesha was amazing. Overall, it is bit pricy but with good quality. This place is not that clean and I didn't expect that either. For a  boys night out, it is pretty good.

Authentic Lebanese hookah place right on Steinway. This isn't a place you want to go to for partying, drinking, etc. Younger people come in at night and on the weekends but it's mostly older Middle Eastern men who frequent Layali Beirut. Good hookah, good food and good service! Tea could be better though.
